title: Equal Left and Right Sum Difference
description: You are given an integer array nums of size N. For every index i, define: leftSum = sum of all elements from index 0 to i−1, rightSum = sum of all elements from index i+1 to N−1. Your task is to find the index i for which the value |leftSum − rightSum| is minimum. If multiple indices give the same minimum value, print the smallest index.
input_format:
The first line contains an integer N — size of the array.
The second line contains N space-separated integers representing nums.
output_format: Print a single integer — the required index.

title: Maximum Frequency After K Increments
description: You are given an array of integers nums and an integer K. In one operation, you can choose any index and increase its value by 1. You can perform at most K operations. After performing operations, determine the maximum possible frequency of any element in the array.
input_format:
First line: integer N
Second line: N integers
Third line: integer K
output_format: Print one integer — maximum possible frequency.

title: Longest Even Sum Prefix
description: You are given an array nums. A prefix is considered valid if the sum of all its elements is even. Find the length of the longest valid prefix.
input_format:
First line: integer N
Second line: array elements
output_format: Print the length of longest valid prefix.

title: Stable Neighbour Positions
description: You are given an array nums and an integer T. An index i is called stable if: |nums[i] − nums[i−1]| ≤ T AND |nums[i] − nums[i+1]| ≤ T. Count how many stable indices exist. Ignore first and last index.
input_format:
First line: N
Second line: nums
Third line: T
output_format: Print the count of stable indices.

title: Replace One Element to Maximize Sum
description: You are given an array nums and an integer X. You must replace exactly one element in the array with value X. Return the maximum possible total sum of the array after replacement.
input_format:
First line: N
Second line: nums
Third line: X

title: Maximum Subarray After One Multiplication
description: You are given an integer array nums and an integer k. You are allowed to choose exactly one contiguous subarray and multiply every element in that subarray by k. After performing this operation once, return the maximum possible subarray sum of the resulting array.
input_format:
First line: nums array
Second line: integer k
output_format: Print the maximum possible subarray sum.

title: Minimum Range After Removing One Subarray
description: You are given an integer array nums. You may remove exactly one contiguous subarray (of any length ≥1). After removal, find the minimum possible value of: max(remaining array) − min(remaining array).
input_format:
First line: integer N
Second line: N integers
output_format: Print the minimum possible range value.

title: Count Subarrays With Sum in Range
description: You are given array nums and integers L and R. Return the number of subarrays whose sum lies in the range [L, R].
input_format:
First line: integer N
Second line: N integers
Third line: L R (range bounds)
output_format: Print the total count of valid subarrays.

title: Longest Segment With Limited Difference
description: You are given an array nums and integer K. Find the longest contiguous subarray such that: max(subarray) − min(subarray) ≤ K.
input_format:
First line: integer N
Second line: N integers
Third line: integer K
output_format: Print the length of the longest valid subarray.

title: Maximum Score by Picking Elements From Ends
description: You are given an integer array nums and integer k. You can pick exactly k elements from either start or end of the array. Return maximum possible sum.
input_format:
First line: integer N
Second line: N integers
Third line: integer k

title: Partition Array Into Three Balanced Parts
description: You are given an integer array nums. Split it into three contiguous non-empty parts such that: sum(part1) ≤ sum(part2) ≤ sum(part3). Return the maximum possible sum of part2.
input_format:
First line: integer N
Second line: N integers
output_format: Print the maximum sum of the middle part.

title: Maximum Product Subarray After Removing One Element
description: You are given an array nums. You must remove exactly one element, then find the maximum product of any contiguous subarray in the remaining array.
input_format:
First line: integer N
Second line: N integers

title: Minimum Operations to Make All Elements Equal
description: You are given an integer array nums. In one operation: choose any contiguous segment and add integer X (positive or negative) to all elements. Find minimum operations required to make all elements equal.
input_format:
First line: integer N
Second line: N integers
output_format: Print the minimum number of operations.

title: Count Valid Pairs With Index Distance Constraint
description: You are given array nums, integer D, and integer S. Count pairs (i, j) such that: i < j, j − i ≤ D, and nums[i] + nums[j] ≤ S.
input_format:
First line: N D S
Second line: N integers representing nums
output_format: Print the count of valid pairs.

title: Maximum Subarray Sum With Length Range
description: You are given array nums and integers L and R. Find maximum sum of a subarray whose length lies in the range [L, R].
input_format:
First line: N L R
Second line: N integers
output_format: Print the maximum subarray sum found.

title: Count Good Substrings
description: You are given a string S consisting of lowercase English letters. A substring is called good if all characters in it are distinct. Find the total number of good substrings of length exactly K.
input_format:
The first line contains string S.
The second line contains integer K.
output_format: Print one integer — number of good substrings.

title: Minimum Changes to Make Alternating String
description: You are given a binary string S. In one operation, you can flip any character (0→1 or 1→0). Find the minimum number of operations required to make the string alternating (e.g., 010101... or 101010...).

title: Longest Prefix Which Is Also Suffix
description: You are given a string S. Find the length of the longest prefix which is also a suffix (excluding the whole string itself).

title: Remove Consecutive Duplicates
description: You are given string S. Remove characters such that no two adjacent characters are the same. Only keep the first character of any consecutive run of duplicates.

title: Character With Maximum Distance
description: You are given string S. For every character, compute the distance between its first and last occurrence. Return the character having the maximum such distance. If there is a tie, return the lexicographically smallest character.

title: Longest Substring With At Most K Distinct Characters
description: You are given a string S consisting of lowercase English letters and an integer K. Find the length of the longest substring that contains at most K distinct characters.
input_format:
First line: string S
Second line: integer K
output_format: Print a single integer — maximum length.

title: Minimum Deletions to Make Character Frequencies Unique
description: You are given a string S. Delete the minimum number of characters so that no two characters have the same frequency. A frequency of 0 is allowed and does not need to be unique.

title: Count Palindromic Substrings of Length ≥ K
description: You are given a string S and an integer K. Count all substrings that are palindromes and have a length greater than or equal to K.
input_format:
Line 1: string S
Line 2: integer K

title: Lexicographically Smallest String After K Swaps
description: You are given string S and integer K. In one operation, you can swap any two adjacent characters. Find the lexicographically smallest string possible after performing at most K swaps.
input_format:
Line 1: string S
Line 2: integer K

title: Longest Repeating Substring After One Replacement
description: You are given a string S. You may replace at most one character with any lowercase letter. Find the length of the longest substring where all characters are the same.

title: Count Distinct Subsequences Equal to Target
description: You are given strings S and T. Count the number of distinct subsequences of S that are equal to T. Since the answer can be large, return the result modulo 10⁹+7.
input_format:
Line 1: string S
Line 2: string T
output_format: Print the total count of subsequences modulo 10⁹+7.

title: Minimum Insertions to Make String Palindrome
description: You are given a string S. In one operation, you can insert any character anywhere in the string. Find the minimum number of insertions required to make the string a palindrome.

title: Longest Substring Appearing At Least K Times
description: You are given string S and an integer K. Find the length of the longest substring where every unique character in that substring appears at least K times.
input_format:
Line 1: string S
Line 2: integer K
output_format: Print the length of the longest valid substring.

title: Minimum Cost to Convert One String to Another
description: You are given two strings A and B of equal length. An operation consists of changing character A[i] to B[i] with a cost equal to the absolute difference between their alphabet positions ($|A[i] - B[i]|$). Find the total minimum cost to convert A into B.
input_format:
Line 1: string A
Line 2: string B

title: Dynamic Queries on String Frequencies
description:
You are given string S. You need to process Q queries of two types:
Type 1: Update index i with character c.
Type 2: Check if the substring from index l to r can be rearranged into a palindrome. A substring can form a palindrome if at most one character has an odd frequency.
input_format:
Line 1: string S
Line 2: integer Q
Next Q lines: queries in format '1 i c' or '2 l r'
output_format: For each type-2 query, print YES if it can form a palindrome, otherwise print NO.

title: Pair With Given Sum in Sorted Array
description: You are given a sorted integer array nums of length N and an integer target. Find if there exists a pair (i, j) such that i < j and nums[i] + nums[j] = target. Print YES if such a pair exists, otherwise print NO.
input_format:
First line: integer N
Second line: N space-separated integers
Third line: integer target

title: Remove Duplicates From Sorted Array
description: You are given a sorted array nums. Remove duplicates in-place such that each element appears only once and return the count of unique elements.
input_format:
First line: integer N
Second line: sorted array nums
output_format: Print the number of unique elements.

title: Check Palindrome String
description: You are given a string S. Check if the string is a palindrome considering only lowercase characters.
output_format: Print YES if palindrome else NO.

title: Move Zeros to End
description: You are given an array nums. Move all zeros to the end while maintaining order of non-zero elements.
input_format:
First line: N
Second line: array nums

title: Count Valid Pairs With Difference ≤ K
description: You are given sorted array nums and integer K. Count pairs (i,j) such that i < j and nums[j] − nums[i] ≤ K.
input_format:
First line: N
Second line: nums
Third line: K

title: Container With Maximum Area Variant
description: You are given array height. Choose two indices i < j such that the area defined by min(height[i], height[j]) × (j − i) is maximum, provided the width (j - i) is at least K. Return maximum area.
input_format:
First line: integer N
Second line: N integers representing height
Third line: integer K

title: Longest Subarray With At Most K Zeros
description: Given binary array nums and integer K. You may flip at most K zeros to ones. Return maximum length subarray containing only ones.
input_format:
First line: N
Second line: N integers (0s and 1s)
Third line: K

title: Count Triplets With Sum < Target
description: Given array nums, count triplets (i,j,k) such that i < j < k and nums[i] + nums[j] + nums[k] < target.
input_format:
First line: N
Second line: N integers
Third line: target

title: Minimum Length Subarray With Sum ≥ Target
description: Given positive array nums and integer target. Find smallest subarray length whose sum ≥ target.
input_format:
First line: N
Second line: N positive integers
Third line: target

title: Count Pairs Across Two Arrays
description: Given two sorted arrays A and B. Count pairs (i,j) such that A[i] + B[j] ≤ X.
input_format:
First line: N M X
Second line: N sorted integers (Array A)
Third line: M sorted integers (Array B)
output_format: Print the total count of valid pairs.

title: Longest Subarray With Difference Between Max and Min ≤ K
description: Given array nums and integer K. Find longest contiguous subarray where: max(subarray) − min(subarray) ≤ K.
input_format:
First line: N K
Second line: N integers
output_format: Print the length of the longest subarray.

title: Count Valid Triangles
description: Given sorted array nums representing side lengths. Count number of triplets that can form a valid triangle. The condition for a triangle is that the sum of any two sides must be greater than the third: a + b > c.
input_format:
First line: N
Second line: N integers representing side lengths
output_format: Print the count of valid triplets.

title: Minimum Operations to Make Array Peaks Valid
description: You are given an integer array arr of size N. An index i (where 1 ≤ i ≤ N−2) is called a peak if: arr[i] > arr[i−1] and arr[i] > arr[i+1]. You are allowed to perform the following operation any number of times: choose an index i and increase or decrease arr[i] by 1. Make at least K peak indices with minimum operations. Return the minimum operations required, or -1 if impossible.
input_format:
First line: Two integers N and K
Second line: N space-separated integers representing the array
output_format: Print a single integer — minimum number of operations required.

title: Minimum Swaps to Group All Ones Together
description: Given a binary array, return the minimum number of swaps required to bring all ones together in any contiguous segment.
input_format:
First line: N
Second line: N integers (0s and 1s)
output_format: Print the minimum number of swaps.

title: Maximum Triplet Product Under Distance Constraint
description: You are given an integer array nums of size N and an integer D. Find three indices (i, j, k) such that i < j < k and (k − i) ≤ D. Among all such valid triplets, maximize the value: nums[i] × nums[j] × nums[k]. Return the maximum possible product. If no such triplet exists, print -1.
input_format:
First line: N D
Second line: N space-separated integers representing nums
output_format: Print the maximum possible product or -1.

title: First Position Greater Than Target
description: You are given a sorted integer array arr of size N and an integer X. Find the first index where the value is strictly greater than X. If no such index exists, print -1.
input_format:
First line: N X
Second line: N space-separated integers

title: Count Numbers ≤ X
description: Given a sorted array arr and integer X, count how many elements are less than or equal to X.
input_format:
First line: N X
Second line: arr elements

title: Find Floor Value
description: Given a sorted array and integer X, find the largest element that is less than or equal to X. If no such element exists, print -1.
input_format:
First line: N X
Second line: N integers

title: Perfect Square Check
description: Given an integer N, determine if it is a perfect square using binary search. If yes, print YES, otherwise print NO.

title: Minimum Element in Rotated Sorted Array
description: A sorted array is rotated an unknown number of times. Find the minimum element in the array.
input_format:
First line: N
Second line: N integers

title: Minimum Time to Complete Tasks
description: You are given N machines. Machine i takes arr[i] minutes to complete one task. Find the minimum time required to complete M tasks if all machines work simultaneously.
input_format:
First line: N M
Second line: arr elements

title: Kth Missing Positive Number
description: Given a sorted positive array, find the K-th missing positive integer.
input_format:
First line: N K
Second line: N integers

title: Allocate Books
description: Given N books with various page counts and S students, assign continuous books to students to minimize the maximum number of pages assigned to any one student.
input_format:
First line: N S
Second line: N integers representing pages

title: Find Peak Element
description: Find any index i such that arr[i] is strictly greater than its neighbors. For elements at the boundary, only the single existing neighbor is considered.
input_format:
First line: N
Second line: N integers

title: Minimum Eating Speed
description: You have piles of food. You can eat k items per hour. Find the minimum eating speed k to finish all piles within H hours.
input_format:
First line: N H
Second line: N integers (piles)

title: Maximum Median After K Increments
description: You are given an array of size N and K operations. In one operation, you can increase any element by 1. Find the maximum possible median of the array after at most K operations.
input_format:
First line: N K
Second line: N integers

title: Split Array to Minimize Largest Sum
description: Split the given array into K contiguous subarrays such that the maximum sum among these subarrays is minimized.
input_format:
First line: N K
Second line: N integers

title: Aggressive Cows Variant
description: Place K routers in houses at sorted positions. Maximize the minimum distance between any two routers.
input_format:
First line: N K
Second line: N integers representing positions
output_format: Print the maximum possible minimum distance.

title: Minimum Days to Make Bouquets
description: Each flower blooms on a specific day. You need to make M bouquets, each using K adjacent bloomed flowers. Find the minimum day on which you can complete the bouquets.
input_format:
First line: N M K
Second line: N integers representing bloom days
output_format: Print the minimum day, or -1 if impossible.

title: Smallest Divisor Under Threshold
description: Find the smallest divisor d such that the sum of the results of dividing all array elements by d (using the ceiling function) is less than or equal to a given threshold.
input_format:
First line: N threshold
Second line: N integers

title: First Unique Element Position
description: You are given an integer array A of size N. Find the first index (0-based) where the element appears exactly once in the entire array. If no such element exists, print -1.

title: Equal Pair Frequency
description: Given array A of size N, count how many values appear exactly twice.

title: Sum Pair Exists
description: Given array A and integer K, determine if there exists any pair (i,j) such that Ai + Aj = K and i ≠ j. Print 'YES' or 'NO'.

title: Frequency Greater Than K
description: Given an array and integer K, print all elements whose frequency is strictly greater than K. Output elements in increasing order.

title: Mirror Frequency Check
description: An array is called mirror-balanced if frequency(x) = frequency(N − x) for every element x present in the array. Determine if the array is mirror-balanced.

title: Longest Balanced 0-1 Subarray
description: You are given a binary array of size N. Find the length of the longest contiguous subarray where the number of 0s equals the number of 1s.

title: Equal Frequency Split Index
description: Find the smallest index i such that the number of distinct elements in the left part A[0…i] is equal to the number of distinct elements in the right part A[i+1…N−1]. Return -1 if no such index exists.

title: Subarrays With Sum Divisible by K
description: Count the number of contiguous subarrays whose sum is divisible by K.

title: Maximum Distance Between Equal Elements
description: Find the maximum value of j − i such that Ai = Aj and i < j. If no duplicate elements exist, print 0.

title: Frequency Based Sort
description: Sort the array based on the following rules: 1) Higher frequency elements come first. 2) If frequencies are the same, the smaller number comes first.

title: Longest Subarray With Equal Frequencies
description: Find the length of the longest contiguous subarray such that all distinct elements inside that subarray appear the same number of times.

title: Count Special Triplets
description: Given an array A of size N, count the number of triplets (i,j,k) such that i < j < k and Ai + Aj = Ak.

title: Dynamic Distinct Counter
description: Process Q queries on an initially empty multiset: 1 x: Insert x. 2 x: Delete one occurrence of x. 3: Print the count of elements that currently have a frequency ≥ 2.

title: Subarrays With Equal Odd–Even Counts
description: Given an integer array A, count the number of subarrays where the count of even numbers equals the count of odd numbers.

title: Maximum Frequency After Operations
description: You are given an array A of size N and an integer K. You may perform at most K operations, where one operation involves increasing any element by 1. Find the maximum frequency of any value achievable after at most K operations.

title: Recursive Digit Sum
description: You are given a non-negative integer N. Define a recursive function: f(n) = n if n < 10, otherwise f(n) = f(sum_of_digits(n)). Your task is to compute and print the value of f(N).

title: Print Reverse Numbers
description: Given integer N, print numbers from N down to 1 using recursion only. Loops are not allowed.

title: Count Zeros in Number
description: Given integer N, count how many digits in it are equal to 0 using recursion.

title: Recursive Array Sum
description: You are given an array of N integers. Compute the sum of all elements using recursion. Recursive Relation: sum(i) = A[i] + sum(i+1). Base case: i == N → return 0.

title: Palindrome String Check
description: Given a string S, determine whether it is a palindrome using recursion. A string is a palindrome if S == reverse(S). Print 'YES' or 'NO'.
constraints:
1 ≤ length(S) ≤ 10^5
S contains only lowercase English letters

title: Generate All Binary Strings
description: Given integer N, generate all binary strings of length N. Print them in lexicographic order.

title: Count Paths in Grid
description: You are at cell (0,0) in a grid of size N × M. You may move only Right or Down. Count the number of distinct paths to reach (N−1,M−1) using recursion.

title: Recursive Power Function
description: Compute X^N using recursion with logarithmic depth. Use the logic: if n is even, $(x^{n/2})^2$; if n is odd, $x * (x^{n/2})^2$.

title: Subset Sum Exists
description: Given an array and an integer K, determine if any subset of the array sums exactly to K. Print YES or NO.

title: Recursive String Permutations
description: Print all permutations of a string with distinct characters using recursion.

test_cases.output:
abc
acb
bac
bca
cab
cba

title: K-th Symbol in Recursive Grammar
description: A grammar sequence is defined: Row 1 is '0'. Row i replaces each 0 with '01' and each 1 with '10' from row i-1. Given N and K, return the Kth symbol in row N (1-indexed).

title: Recursive Expression Evaluator
description: Evaluate a mathematical expression containing digits (0–9), +, −, *, /, and parentheses (). No spaces, division is integer division.

title: Count Valid Parentheses Strings
description: Given integer N, count how many valid parentheses strings of length 2N can be formed. A string is valid if every opening bracket has a matching closing bracket and closing brackets never exceed opening brackets.

title: Minimum Operations to Reduce to 1
description: Given integer N, reduce it to 1 in minimum steps. Operations: divide by 3 (if divisible), divide by 2 (if divisible), or subtract 1.

title: Maximum Score Path in Recursive Grid
description: In an N × N grid starting from (0,0), reach (N−1,N−1). You may move Right, Down, or Diagonal. Find the maximum score path sum using recursion.

title: Valid Stack Sequence
description: You are given two integer sequences: Push sequence P and Pop sequence Q. Determine whether Q could be a valid pop order of a stack if elements are pushed in the order given by P. You must simulate the stack behavior exactly.
input_format:
N
P1 P2 ... PN
Q1 Q2 ... QN

title: Queue After Operations
description: Process Q operations on a queue: ENQ X (enqueue), DEQ (dequeue), and FRONT (get front). Handle 'EMPTY' cases for invalid operations.
output_format: Result of each FRONT query or 'EMPTY'.

title: Next Greater Element
description: For each element in array A, find the nearest element to its right that is strictly greater. If none exists, print -1. This should be solved in O(N) using a stack.

title: Balanced Brackets Check
description: Given a string S containing characters '(', ')', '{', '}', '[', and ']', determine if the brackets are balanced. Every opening bracket must have a matching closing bracket of the same type in the correct order.

title: Stack Minimum Query
description: Design a stack that supports push, pop, and retrieving the minimum element in constant time. Handle 'EMPTY' for operations on an empty stack.

title: Nearest Smaller Element to Left
description: For each element in an array, find the nearest element to its left that is strictly smaller. If no such element exists, print -1.

title: Circular Next Greater Element
description: Find the next greater element for each element in a circular array. If the next greater doesn't exist to the right, wrap around to the beginning.

title: Queue Using Two Stacks
description: Implement a FIFO queue using only two LIFO stacks. Support enqueue, dequeue, and front operations.

title: Longest Valid Parentheses Length
description: Given a string of '(' and ')', find the length of the longest contiguous valid (well-formed) parentheses substring.

title: Stack Permutation Count Check
description: Determine if a target permutation P can be generated by pushing numbers 1 to N into a stack and popping them at appropriate times.

title: Maximum of Minimums for Every Window Size
description: For every window size k (1 to N), find the maximum value among the minimum values of all subarrays of size k. Use monotonic stacks to find the 'span' of each element as a minimum.

title: Sum of Subarray Minimums
description: Calculate the sum of the minimum values of all possible subarrays of A. Return result modulo 10^9+7. The contribution of each A[i] is Ai * (left_span * right_span).

title: Maximum Rectangle in Histogram
description: Given an array representing heights of bars in a histogram, find the area of the largest rectangle that can be formed within the histogram.

title: Sliding Window Maximum
description: Given array A and window size K, find the maximum element for every sliding window of size K as it moves from left to right.

title: Remove K Digits to Form Smallest Number
description: Given a numeric string S, remove exactly K digits to make the resulting number as small as possible. The order of remaining digits cannot be changed.

title: Maximum Sum Subarray of Size K
description: You are given an integer array A of size N and an integer K. Find the maximum sum of any contiguous subarray of length exactly K. Use the sliding window technique to avoid recalculating the sum from scratch for each window.

title: First Negative Number in Every Window
description: Given array A and window size K, print the first negative number encountered in every window of size K. If a window contains no negative number, print 0.

title: Count Windows With Sum ≤ X
description: Given array A, window size K, and integer X, count how many subarrays of length exactly K have a sum less than or equal to X.
input_format:
N K X
A1 A2 ... AN

title: Minimum in Every Window
description: Given array A and window size K, print the minimum element of each sliding window of size K.

title: Longest Subarray With Sum ≤ K
description: Given array A and integer K, find the length of the longest contiguous subarray whose sum is less than or equal to K.

title: Maximum Stable Segment
description: A segment is stable if the difference between the maximum and minimum elements in that segment is ≤ K. Find the length of the longest such contiguous subarray.

title: Minimum Window with Exact Sum
description: Find the minimum length of a contiguous subarray whose sum equals exactly S. If no such subarray exists, print -1.

title: Longest Substring with Limited Distinct Characters
description: Find the length of the longest substring that contains at most K distinct characters.

title: Subarrays with Product Less Than K
description: Count the number of contiguous subarrays whose product is strictly less than K.

title: Longest Binary Segment After Flips
description: In a binary array, you can flip at most K zeros to ones. Find the maximum length of a contiguous segment consisting only of ones after performing the flips.

title: Smallest Window With Exactly K Distinct Numbers
description: Find the length of the smallest contiguous subarray that contains exactly K distinct integers. Print -1 if no such subarray exists.

title: Maximum Frequency After K Replacements
description: Given an array and an integer K, find the maximum possible length of a subarray such that all elements can be made equal by replacing at most K elements.

title: Count Subarrays With Sum in Range
primary_skill: Prefix Sum + Sliding Window / Binary Search
description: Count the number of contiguous subarrays whose sum lies between L and R inclusive. For arrays with only positive numbers, use sliding window; for negative numbers, use prefix sums with a balanced BST or Fenwick Tree.

title: Longest Subarray With Limited Distinct Difference
description: Find the longest subarray where the difference between the maximum and minimum elements is at most K.

title: Minimum Window Covering All Required Values
description: Find the length of the smallest subarray of A that contains every value from list B at least once. Print -1 if impossible.
input_format:
N M
A1 A2 ... AN
B1 B2 ... BM

title: Climbing Stairs With Cost
description:
You are given an integer N. You are standing at step 0 and want to reach step N. You may climb: 1 step or 2 steps. Each step i has a cost Ci. You must pay the cost of every step you land on. Find the minimum total cost to reach step N.

Input Format:
The first line contains an integer N.
The second line contains N+1 space-separated integers C0, C1, ..., CN.

Output Format:
Single integer — minimum cost.

Explanation:
For Sample Input (4, costs: 1 100 1 1 1):
Best path: step 0 → step 2 → step 4
Cost = 1 + 1 + 1 = 3.

title: Maximum Sum of Non-Adjacent Elements
description:
Given an array A of size N, find maximum sum of elements such that no two chosen elements are adjacent.

Input Format:
The first line contains integer N.
The second line contains N space-separated integers A1, A2, ..., AN.

Output Format:
Maximum sum.

Explanation:
For Sample Input (5, elements: 3 2 7 10 12):
Choose elements at indices 0, 2, and 4: 3 + 7 + 12 = 22.

title: Count Ways to Reach N
description:
You start at position 0 and want to reach N. Allowed moves: +1 step, +3 steps, +5 steps. Count number of distinct ways to reach exactly N.

Input Format:
Single integer N.

Output Format:
Number of ways.

Explanation:
For N=5, ways are:
1+1+1+1+1
1+1+3
3+1+1
1+3+1
5
Total = 5.

title: Longest Increasing Prefix Length
description:
Given array A, find length of longest prefix such that elements are strictly increasing. You must compute this using dynamic programming.

Input Format:
The first line contains integer N.
The second line contains N space-separated integers.

Output Format:
Length.

Explanation:
Prefix increasing sequence for [1, 2, 3, 2, 4, 5, 6] is 1, 2, 3. The length is 3. It stops when 2 appears because 2 is not greater than 3.

title: Minimum Operations to Make Array Zero
description:
You are given an array A of size N. In one operation you may choose any element and: subtract 1 or subtract 2. Find minimum operations required to make all elements equal to 0.

Input Format:
The first line contains integer N.
The second line contains N space-separated integers.

Output Format:
Minimum operations.

Explanation:
For array [1, 2, 3]:
1 takes 1 step (subtract 1).
2 takes 1 step (subtract 2).
3 takes 2 steps (subtract 2, then subtract 1).
Total = 4 steps.

title: Weighted Alternating Subsequence
description:
You are given an array A of size N. You must choose a subsequence such that: Elements alternate increase → decrease → increase → … and the first comparison must be an increase. Score of subsequence = sum of its elements. Find the maximum score possible.

Input Format:
The first line contains integer N.
The second line contains N space-separated integers.

Output Format:
Maximum score.

Explanation:
For [4, 7, 2, 9, 1, 5], the subsequence 4 → 7 → 2 → 9 → 1 → 5 alternates correctly and yields a sum of 20.

title: Minimum Cost Partition with Penalty
description:
Given array A and integer K, split the array into exactly K contiguous groups. Cost of a group: (max_element - min_element)². Minimize total cost.

Input Format:
The first line contains N and K.
The second line contains N integers.

Output Format:
Minimum cost.

Explanation:
For [1, 5, 2, 8, 3] and K=2, the optimal split is [1, 5, 2] and [8, 3].
Group 1 cost: (5-1)² = 16. Group 2 cost: (8-3)² = 25. Note: The sample logic implies searching for the absolute minimum over all possible split points.

title: Count Valid Binary Strings with Blocks
description:
Given integers N and M, count binary strings of length N such that: No more than M consecutive 1s appear. Return answer modulo 10⁹+7.

Input Format:
Two integers N and M.

Output Format:
Count of valid strings.

Explanation:
For N=4, M=2, invalid strings are 1110, 0111, 1111. Total strings = 2⁴ = 16. Valid = 16 - 3 = 13.

title: Maximum Profit with Cooldown and Fee
description:
You are given stock prices for N days and an integer F (transaction fee). You may buy and sell multiple times, but after selling, you must wait 1 day (cooldown). Every sell costs fee F. Maximize profit.

Input Format:
The first line contains N and F.
The second line contains N prices.

Output Format:
Maximum profit.

Constraints:
1 ≤ N ≤ 2×10⁵
1 ≤ price ≤ 10⁹
0 ≤ F ≤ 10⁹

title: Longest Path with Limited Turns
description:
You are given a grid N × M with integers. You start at (0,0) and must reach (N−1,M−1). Allowed moves: Right, Down. Constraint: You can change direction at most K times. Maximize sum of visited cells.

Input Format:
First line: N M K.
Following N lines: grid values.

Output Format:
Maximum sum.

Explanation:
Path: 1 → 4 → 7 → 8 → 9 uses only one turn (at cell 4). Sum = 29.

title: Weighted Increasing Subsequence with Gap Cost
description:
You are given an array A of size N and an array W of weights. You must choose a strictly increasing subsequence of indices. Score formula: (sum of weights Wi) - (sum of absolute differences between consecutive indices |idx_j - idx_i|). Find the maximum possible score.

Input Format:
The first line contains N.
The second line contains A1...AN.
The third line contains W1...WN.

Output Format:
Maximum score.

Explanation:
Optimal subsequence indices [1, 4, 5]. Weights: 5 + 3 + 6 = 14. Penalty: |4-1| + |5-4| = 3 + 1 = 4. Score = 14 - 4 = 10 (Note: Sample explanation says 15 - 4 = 11, implying weights 5, 7, 6).

title: K Segment Maximum XOR Partition
description:
You are given an array of N integers and an integer K. Partition array into exactly K contiguous segments. Define segment value as: (XOR sum of elements) × (length of segment). Maximize total value.

Input Format:
First line: N K.
Second line: N integers.

Output Format:
Maximum value.

Constraints:
1 ≤ N ≤ 500
1 ≤ K ≤ N
0 ≤ Ai ≤ 10⁹

title: String Compression with Removals
description:
You are given a string S and integer K. You may delete at most K characters. After deletions, compress string using rule: aaaa → a4, bbb → b3, c → c. Goal: minimize compressed length.

Input Format:
First line: S.
Second line: K.

Output Format:
Minimum compressed length.

Explanation:
Delete 'b' and 'd' from 'aaabcccd' to get 'aaaccc'. Compressed 'a3c3' has length 4.

title: Grid Path with Energy Recharge
description:
You are given an N×M grid. Each cell contains: positive number (energy gained), negative number (energy lost), or '#' (blocked). You start at (0,0) with energy E. Rules: Move right or down. Energy must never drop below 1. If energy > LIMIT, it resets to LIMIT. Find number of valid paths to (N−1,M−1) modulo 10⁹+7.

Input Format:
First line: N M E LIMIT.
Following N lines: grid values.

Output Format:
Number of valid paths.

Constraints:
1 ≤ N,M ≤ 200
−100 ≤ cell ≤ 100
1 ≤ E ≤ 100
1 ≤ LIMIT ≤ 200

title: Palindromic Subsequence With Cost Budget
description:
You are given: string S, integer array cost[26], and integer budget B. You may pick any palindromic subsequence. Each chosen character costs its letter cost. Goal: maximize palindrome length without exceeding budget.

Input Format:
First line: S.
Second line: 26 integers representing costs of 'a' through 'z'.
Third line: budget B.

Output Format:
Maximum length.

Constraints:
1 ≤ |S| ≤ 200
1 ≤ cost[i] ≤ 100
1 ≤ B ≤ 10⁴

title: Count Connected Villages
description:
You are given an undirected graph representing villages connected by roads. Each village belongs to exactly one connected region. Find how many connected regions exist.

Input Format:
The first line contains N (number of villages) and M (number of roads).
The next M lines contain pairs of integers u and v representing a road between village u and v.

Output Format:
A single integer representing the number of connected components.

Explanation:
For N=5, M=2 with roads (1,2) and (4,5), the components are {1,2}, {3}, and {4,5}. Total = 3.

title: Shortest Path in Binary Maze
description:
You are given an N × M grid where 0 represents a blocked cell and 1 represents a free cell. You start at (0,0) and want to reach (N-1, M-1). You can move up, down, left, or right. Find the minimum number of steps required, or -1 if unreachable.

Input Format:
The first line contains N and M.
The next N lines contain a string of length M consisting of 0s and 1s.

Output Format:
Single integer representing the minimum steps.

Explanation:
(0,0) → (0,1) → (0,2) → (1,2) → (2,2) is the shortest path of length 4.

title: DFS Subtree Size
description:
You are given a tree with N nodes rooted at node 1. For every node, calculate and print the size of its subtree. The subtree size of a node includes itself and all its descendants.

Input Format:
The first line contains N.
The next N-1 lines contain edges (u, v).

Output Format:
N integers representing the subtree sizes for nodes 1 to N.

title: Flood Fill Regions
description:
You are given a grid of lowercase letters. Cells belong to the same region if they have the same character and are connected 4-directionally. Find the total number of distinct regions in the grid.

Input Format:
The first line contains N and M.
The next N lines contain strings of length M representing the grid.

Output Format:
A single integer representing the count of distinct regions.

title: Nodes Reachable Within K Steps
description:
You are given an undirected graph and a starting node S. Find how many nodes (excluding the start node itself) can be reached using at most K edges.

Input Format:
N M S K followed by M edges.

Output Format:
Single integer representing the count of reachable nodes.

Explanation:
Nodes at distance 1 are {2, 5}. Nodes at distance 2 are {3, 6}. Total = 4.

title: Restricted City Reachability
description:
You are given N cities and M roads. Some cities are restricted and cannot be entered. Starting from city S, find the number of cities you can reach without ever passing through a restricted city.

Input Format:
N M
M lines of edges
R (number of restricted nodes)
List of R restricted nodes
S (starting node)

Output Format:
Number of reachable cities.

title: Minimum Steps to Convert Number
description:
Given integers 'start' and 'target', and an array of operations 'ops', find the minimum number of additions required to reach the target from the start. Each operation in 'ops' can be used any number of times. Valid states are between 0 and 10^5.

Input Format:
start target
N (size of ops)
ops array

Output Format:
Minimum operations or -1 if impossible.

title: Island Expansion Time
description:
You are given a grid where 1 is land and 0 is water. Every minute, water adjacent to land becomes land. Find the total time required for the entire grid to become land. If it's impossible, print -1.

Input Format:
N M
N lines of M integers (0 or 1).

Output Format:
Minutes required.

title: DFS Path Value Maximum
description:
Given a directed graph where each node has a value, find the maximum possible sum of values on a path. You may start at any node, but you cannot revisit any node in a single path.

Input Format:
N M
V1...VN (node values)
M lines of edges

Output Format:
Maximum score.

title: Closest Special Node
description:
You are given an undirected graph with normal nodes and some 'special' nodes. For every node i from 1 to N, compute the shortest distance to any special node.

Input Format:
N M
M lines of edges
K (number of special nodes)
List of special nodes

Output Format:
N space-separated distances.

title: Time-Locked Graph Escape
description:
Each node i becomes accessible only after time Ti. You start at node 1 at time 0. Moving along an edge takes 1 unit of time. You may wait at any node. Find the minimum time to reach node N.

Input Format:
N M
T1...TN
M lines of edges

Output Format:
Minimum time or -1.

title: Maximum XOR Path Without Revisit
description:
Travel from node 1 to node N without revisiting nodes. Find the maximum possible XOR sum of all node values along the path.

Input Format:
N M
values array
M lines of edges

Output Format:
Maximum XOR score.

title: Multi-Color Spread Simulation
description:
A grid contains multiple colored sources. Every minute, colors spread to neighbors. If multiple colors reach a cell at the same time, the color with the smallest index wins. Return the grid state after T minutes.

Input Format:
N M K T
N lines of grid strings

Output Format:
Final grid after T minutes.

title: Directed Graph Safe Nodes
description:
A node is safe if all paths starting from it eventually end at a terminal node. Terminal nodes have no outgoing edges. Cycles are unsafe. Return all safe nodes in ascending order.

Input Format:
N M followed by M edges.

Output Format:
Space-separated list of safe nodes.

title: Shortest Path With Edge Reversal Limit
description:
Given a directed graph, find the shortest path from 1 to N. You are allowed to reverse at most K existing edges during your traversal.

Input Format:
N M K followed by M edges.

Output Format:
Minimum distance or -1.
